newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: CRICKET-AKRAM AND SAQLAIN COMPLETE DOUBLE CENTURY PARTNERSHIP.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-AKRAM AND SAQLAIN COMPLETE DOUBLE CENTURY PARTNERSHIP.

text.p: Pakistan captain
Wasim Akram and Saqlain Mushtaq took their record-breaking
eighth-wicket stand to 206 by lunch on the fourth day of the
first test against Zimbabwe on Sunday.
Pakistan, resuming at 395 for seven, had moved on to 443 for
seven in their first innings at the end of a session shortened
by 50 minutes because of light rain. They led Zimbabwe by 68
runs.
Saqlain, 37 overnight, reached his maiden test half century
with a cracking square cut off medium pacer Guy Whittal. His
painstaking 50 took 280 minutes off 250 balls.
Akram, who reached a test best 144 on Saturday, made the
most of a "life" soon after play began to move on to 174 at
lunch.
He had not added to his overnight score when David Houghton
dropped him off Whittal at mid-off.
Akram celebrated his escape by twice lifting leg spinner
Paul Strang for huge sixes.
His seventh six broke the Pakistani record of six sixes in a
test innings held by Haroon Rasheed since the 1977-78 home
series against England.
